page.title: 13CHEQUERS
page.content: {FAMOUS MANSION NEAR DUNSMORE An estate of 14.5 hides on this site is mentioned in the original Domesday Book, but the first connection with today's name of Chequers came 50yrs later when the Scaccarios acquired the property. Their name meaning checker_ board. The present house dates from Tudor times when rebuilt by the Hawtrey family who, with the Crokes and Russells kept a fine family link for many years. Lady Mary Grey, sister of Lady Jane, was held there and the house has many Cronwellian relics. More recently, it was in the Long Gallery that the British and French P.M's. agreed with General Smuts Of S. Africa & Marshall Foch of France the strategy of single command which at last brought victory in the 1914_18 War. The last owner Lord Lee of Fareham gave it to the nation in 1917.
